result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey Jernigan Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay fine of $1,000 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Bond to apply - Balance to be made @ regular interals commencing 9/1/16.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
DOC shall promptly notify the court in writing of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
***AS OF 7/12/19 REVIEW HEARING -  DEFT HAS 6 MOS TO PAY HIS FINANCIAL OBLIGATAION.  IN DEFAULT, 21 DAYS WORK CREW OR 21 DAYS KCJ.  ALTERNATIVE TO NON PYMT WILL BE REDUCED DEPENDING ON WHAT MONIES ARE PAID W/N THE NEXT 6 MONTHS.  DE'S PROBATION MAY DISCHARGE ON 7/14/19.***

Minutes:  15CF302/15CF1153.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Doug Henderson.  Brief arguments on the State's motion for joinder; motion is granted.  Court takes a short recess to handle other cases.  Cases recalled - deft now wishes to accept the plea offer.  Brief discussion held.  Court will allow the plea bargain for the reasons set forth on the record even though a ludwig hrg was previously held.  

15CF302 - deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 6/29/16 @ 1:30pm

15CF1153 - case dismissed on State's motion per plea agreement.  Bond to be held pending outcome of sentencing hrg.

Sheskey.  No further evidence presented by either side.  Arguments heard.  Motion to suppress is denied as to 15CF302 but granted as to 15CF1153.  Court takes a short recess to allow defense counsel to confer w/his client.  Court reconvenes @ noon.  Case set over to 1pm this afternoon.  Case recalled @ 1:50pm.  Defense counsel reports the deft is rejecting the plea offer.  Ludwig hrg previously held.  JS to remain on for 3/21/16 @ 9am.
